Older people's events

Top Time: events, activities for older people, with refreshments

Thursday, 1400-1500

  • First Thursday of the month: Reading group
  • Second Thursday of the month: Quiz for individuals - free, drop in
  • Third Thursday of the month: Guest speaker - free, drop in
  • Fourth Thursday of the month: Bingo - free, drop in
  • Fifth Thursday of the month (where applicable): Crafts with Vicky - £2.50 per person, booking essential

A wellbeing singing project for family carers, people managing long-term mental or physical health issues and anyone who believes that singing with others might add to their quality of life! Supported by the D'oyly Carte Trust, Elly's Fund and donations.

fourth Monday of the month, 1000-1200

Drop-in support for people suffering with cancer and their carers. Meet others, have a chat and pick up information leaflets. Coffee, tea and biscuits provided.

Talking with Teens: for 11-16 year-olds

Friday, 1600-1730

Come and talk with other teenagers about emotional health and wellbeing, exam stress, online safety, relationships, drugs and alcohol etc. Drinks and snacks provided.

second Tuesday of the month, 1100-1145

A chance to chat and play, with a monthly visit from a health visitor for extra support.

Mindfulness-based stress reduction classes: all welcome

Some Mondays - see the Harnessing Happiness for upcoming classes., 1115-1245

Drop-in, £12. Relax and unwind to combat stress, anxiety and worry through mindfulness and meditation. All welcome. Email debrawoodbridge@gmail.com, call 01394 450066 or visit http://www.harnessinghappiness.co.uk for more information.

ActivLives Singing Group: £5 per session.

Fridays 15 & 29 March, 5 & 26 April, 10 & 17 May, 7 & 21 June, 5 & 19 July, 16 & 30 August., 1030-1230

Lift your spirits and confidence with singing. Learn new songs and harmonies and improve your breathing and circulation while having fun and making new friends. To find out more, call Julie Stokes on 01473345350 or visit the ActivLives website.

Suffolk Coastal Three Principles Community conversations

second Saturday of the month, 1015-1145

Look at mental health in a whole new way. These conversations, led by Mia Philips, explore how our experience of life is created, our innate resilience and our true nature. £7 per session, no booking required. Visit the Suffolk Coastal Three Principles Community Facebook page or Mia's website for more information.

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Energy clinic from the Citizens' Advice Bureau

first Tuesday of the month, 1000-1200

Bring along your latest gas and electricity bills and find out how you can save money, get extra help from your energy company and insulate your home more.

Homegroup: drop in to the Children's Centre for support with housing issues

every other Monday, 1300-1500

Free, confidential support for anyone aged 16+. Includes money, budgeting and debt advice, help accessing community and social networks and housing application systems, and information about keeping and managing your home to benefit your health and wellbeing.
